meanings.definition: A preference or inclination towards something.
meanings.sent1: Her ruther for chocolate over vanilla was evident in her choice of dessert.
meanings.sent2: His ruther for sunny weather made him plan a picnic for the weekend.
meanings.sent3: Despite his ruther for sleeping in, he forced himself to wake up early for work.
meanings.sent4: She had a ruther for adventure, always seeking new experiences and challenges.
meanings.sent5: His ruther for helping others made him a beloved member of the community.

meanings.sent1: I ruther to read books than watch TV in my free time.
meanings.sent2: She would ruther eat pizza for dinner every night if she could.
meanings.sent3: He would ruther walk to work than deal with rush hour traffic.
meanings.sent4: They ruther to spend their vacation exploring nature rather than lounging on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The cat would ruther play with a simple cardboard box than an expensive toy.

meanings.sent1: She ruther agreed to help her friend with the project.
meanings.sent2: He ruther completed the task before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The dog ruther followed its owner wherever she went.
meanings.sent4: They ruther accepted the challenge with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The flowers ruther bloomed in the sunlight, reaching towards the sky.
